definition: to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

sentences.english: Consecutive art space upstairs and downstairs is everyone's life stage.
sentences.chinese: 樓上樓下連貫的藝術空間，是每個人的生活舞臺。

sentences.english: Punctuation marks are an integrant sign of cohesion and coherence in modern writing.
sentences.chinese: 標點符號是現代書面語中不可缺少的銜接和連貫標誌。

sentences.english: Coherence refers to the belonging together or the various parts of the artwork.
sentences.chinese: 連貫性是指一件藝術品各個部分屬性協調一致。

sentences.english: These  fragmented ads spoil the fun and disturb the plot flow.
sentences.chinese: 這些插片廣告極大地破壞了劇情的連貫性和趣味性。

sentences.english: Key technology and method to display serial processed DIB image is presented.
sentences.chinese: 着重敘述DIB位圖連貫顯示的技術要點和實現方法。

sentences.english: Finally, the cohesion and coherence of discourse also have an impact on the translation of polysemic words.
sentences.chinese: 同時，語篇的銜接與連貫也作用於多義詞的翻譯。

sentences.english: Metaphor Systematicity and Its Contribution to Textual Coherence;
sentences.chinese: 語境對語篇連貫有一定製約作用。

sentences.english: He skillfully fuses these fragments into a cohesive whole.
sentences.chinese: 他巧妙地把這些片斷合併成連貫的整體。

sentences.english: There were obvious flaws and lack of fluidity and syncronization in their programs.
sentences.chinese: 他們有明顯的瑕疵而且缺乏連貫和同步性。

sentences.english: Tumor is far from perfect, having no clear climax and a fragmented storyline.
sentences.chinese: 影片沒有明確的高潮，情節也過於碎片化，不夠連貫。

sentences.english: Words thus strung together fall on the ears like music.
sentences.chinese: 連貫的話語聽起來有音樂感。

sentences.english: Before his crash Matej's use of the English language was broken, to put it mildly.
sentences.chinese: 說得委婉一點，梅特庫斯撞車前的英語是不連貫的。

sentences.english: The text should be read aloud coherently.
The Norlander philosophy is 'firm but fair, with consistency'.
sentences.chinese: 諾蘭的哲學是‘堅定公平而連貫’。

sentences.english: On pours the exhausted movement the continuity two to be mad that becomes.
sentences.chinese: 應注憊動作的連貫性二氣呵成。

sentences.english: Disconnection is one of the great causes of failure.
sentences.chinese: 沒有連貫性是失敗的重要原因之一。

definition: closely linked with one another/interlocked/to interrelate
arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
to establish ties or contact/in series connection (electricity)
